results.title: Wallace & Gromit: the wrong trousers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nick Park, Christopher Moll and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Once again our plasticine heroes are plunged into a hilarious tale of skullduggery involving an extraordinary pair of automated trousers and a villanous penguin. Posing as an innocent lodger, the fiendish fish-eater sets about recruiting mild-mannered Wallace as unwitting accomplice to his dastardly plot; a diamond heist. It is left to the faithful Gromit to turn detective and save the day as malice and mayhem culminate in a breathless train chase around the sitting room.

results.title: Wallace & Gromit: a grand day out
results.brief_description: Wallace likes a nice bit of cheese with his crackers, so when the eccentric inventor finds his fridge empty and the local corner shop shut for Bank Holiday, he is forced to look further afield for his cheddar. His faithful dog Gromit is used to his master’s flights of fancy, but this time his ears prick up with excitement as the two plasticene heroes blast off in their home-made rocket on the ultimate day-trip to the Moon! For children and adults alike, the animation techniques used in this production are quite incredible.

results.title: WALL·E
results.brief_description: WALL·E is the last robot left on an Earth that has been overrun with garbage and all humans have fled to outer space. For 700 years he has continued to try and clean up the mess, but has developed some rather interesting human-like qualities.

constellations_other.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_other.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

results.description: WALL·E is the last robot left on an Earth that has been overrun with garbage and all humans have fled to outer space. For 700 years he has continued to try and clean up the mess, but has developed some rather interesting human-like qualities. When a ship arrives with a sleek new type of robot, WALL·E thinks he’s finally found a friend and stows away on the ship when it leaves.

results.title: Wall Street, CP-B37 Reel Six Vitaphone record
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Wall Street
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Edward Pressman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Skinny neckties and double-breasted suits adorn Wall Street, which follows the path of Bud Fox (Charlie Sheen) into a milieu of corporate capitalism. He soon realises to stay in this new world with high-powered corporate espionage player Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas) he must break a few rules. Gekko represents one of three father figures for Fox, the other two being his real father and his boss at the broking firm, all of whom give him constant advice. However, Fox’s overwhelming desire for gold cufflinks and brick-like cellular phones steer him down the path of corruption and greed and he soon realises the price of the pursuit of overnight success. Director Oliver Stone captures the hectic hum of the commerce world and encapsulates the greed that is synonymous with the rise of capitalism in the 1980s. Michael Douglas received an Oscar for Best Actor at the 1987 Academy Awards for his role as Gekko.

results.title: Wall of fear
results.brief_description: A widow, her son and mother newly settled in new location is terrified by a hoodlum, whom she had earlier humiliated in front of a crows od younger kids, when she slapped his face after she caught him ill-treating a younger boy. Her efforts to enlist the aid of the police, and others, are fruitless, she takes into her own hands, obtains a revolver, catches the terrorist in her son’s bedroom. The subsequent scenes show how she obtained a new friend. Cast includes; Susan Douglas, Eleanor Beecroft, Douglas Master, Jena Keller and herb Fisher.

results.title: Walking with my sisters (A)
results.creator_credit: Bronwyn Kidd and Big Cat Productions
results.brief_description: Walking with my sisters is an engaging documentary about the struggle of three Aboriginal sisters to have their native title rights acknowledged and their land returned to them. The three Aboriginal sisters - Lorna Kelly, Linda Vidler and Yvonne Graham - are the traditional custodians of the Byron Bay area, and a main criterion they must meet in the claims process is to prove that they are in fact descendents of this land and not migrants from elsewhere. “Walking with my sisters” gives a broad outline of the various steps involved in making native title claims, such as the endless negotiations and the many interested parties and competing interests. Behind this complex process, however, lies the fact that Indigenous peoples were the original inhabitants of the land and that part of the ongoing process of reconciliation and defining Australia’s past and future involves grappling with this truth. Filmed over several years, “Walking with my sisters” shows a positive outcome to a long and deeply felt battle against what - at large - can be identified as cultural denial.

results.title: Walking with dinosaurs: The Ballad of Big Al
results.brief_description: Narrated by Kenneth Brannagh and using the computer graphic and animatronic techniques created by the team behind the amazing “Walking with Dinosaurs” series, this program resurrects Big Al, an Allosaurus who lived 145 million years ago. The first program is the recreated story of his 15-year life, a constant battle against formidable prey and voracious predators. The second program is a scientific detective story which traces the evidence of Big Al. Using the same graphic effects, we follow Big Al as he roams museums and archaeological dig sites where we see passionate scientists explaining the research behind his tale.

results.title: Walking with dinosaurs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tim Haines, TV Asahi, Discovery Channel and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Walking with dinosaurs”.
Imagine if you could witness a Cretaceous sunset, watch as insectivorous pterosaurs chase moths in the evening, and bull triceratops lock horns over a young female. This is no longer a dream. “Walking with dinosaurs” is a six episode series that transports the viewer back to prehistoric times when dinosaurs ruled the earth. Using CGI animation, all the major eras - Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous - are faithfully recreated with stunning authenticity as classic natural history techniques meld with state of the art computer graphics. Filmed against spectacular natural backdrops in Chile, Tasmania and New Zealand and narrated by Kenneth Branagh, this series sets new standards for TV production and striked a perfect balance between information and entertainment. In addition to the six, 30 minute episodes is a behind the scenes look at the technological and labour intesive work that went into place to make the series possible. Individual episodes include; “New blood”, “A Time of titans”, “Cruel sea”, “Giant of the skies”, “Spirits of the ice forest” and “Death of a dynasty”. Comprehensive website at www.bbc.co.uk/dinosaurs. Also available on VHS [310597], [310599], [310598], “Making of” [310593].
